New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Detroit left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season
Key Match Events: Spencer Torkelson hit a one-out single and Zach McKinstry extended his hitting streak to a career-best 11 games with a double
Trey Sweeney hit a fly ball to left ball that Rob Refsnyder couldn't play against the wall, driving in two with a double
Tarik Skubal pitched eight innings and struck out eight to become the fourth Detroit left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers celebrated the franchise's 1984 World Series championship with a 2-1 win over the Boston Red Sox
Jack Morris threw the ceremonial first pitch to Lance Parrish
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal said it was a little fitting that it was the 1984 night and that's the deepest he's pitched into a game
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said Tarik is a special player, he's anchored this staff all season
Red Sox manager Alex Cora said he wasn't surprised that Joey Cora made the decision to send McKinstry to the plate
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers moved within 1 1/2 games of Boston for fourth in the American League wild-card race
Boston's Nick Pivetta allowed two runs on six hits and a walk in six innings
The game was played at Comerica Park in front of a crowd of 34,355
